column.name: name
column.value: HUD-VASH Housing Program

column.name: description
column.value: The HUD-VA Supportive Housing (HUD-VASH) program combines Housing Choice Voucher (HCV) rental assistance for homeless Veterans with case management and clinical services provided by the Department of Veterans Affairs. VA provides these services for participating Veterans at VA medical centers (VAMCs) and community-based outreach clinics.

column.name: eligibility_criteria
column.value: Veterans who are homeless and have a VA qualifying chronic health condition such as mental illness, substance use disorder, or physical disability

column.name: name
column.value: VA Grant and Per Diem Program

column.name: description
column.value: Offers grants to community organizations that provide transitional housing and service centers for homeless Veterans. The program promotes the development and provision of supportive housing and services with the goal of helping homeless Veterans achieve residential stability, increase their skill levels, and improve their income.

column.name: eligibility_criteria
column.value: Homeless Veterans seeking transitional housing assistance

column.name: name
column.value: Swords to Plowshares

column.name: description
column.value: Provides comprehensive services to homeless and at-risk Veterans in the San Francisco Bay Area including housing placement, case management, employment services, and legal assistance.

column.name: address_line1
column.value: 1060 Howard Street

column.name: city
column.value: San Francisco

column.name: eligibility_criteria
column.value: Veterans in the San Francisco Bay Area

column.name: name
column.value: U.S. VETS

column.name: description
column.value: The largest nonprofit provider of comprehensive services to homeless and at-risk Veterans nationwide. Provides housing, case management, employment assistance, and counseling services.

column.name: eligibility_criteria
column.value: Homeless and at-risk Veterans

column.name: name
column.value: VA Disability Compensation

column.name: description
column.value: Monthly tax-free payment to Veterans who got sick or injured while serving in the military and to Veterans whose service made an existing condition worse. You may qualify for VA disability benefits for physical conditions and mental health conditions.

column.name: eligibility_criteria
column.value: Veterans with service-connected disabilities rated at 10% or higher

column.name: name
column.value: VA Pension Benefits

column.name: description
column.value: Tax-free monetary benefit for wartime Veterans with limited income who are age 65 or older, or who have a permanent and total disability, or who are a patient in a nursing home, or who are receiving Social Security disability benefits.

column.name: eligibility_criteria
column.value: Wartime Veterans age 65+ or with permanent disabilities and limited income

column.name: name
column.value: VA Home Loan Guaranty

column.name: description
column.value: VA-backed home loans help Veterans, service members, and their surviving spouses become homeowners. Through this program, lenders can offer favorable loan terms with no down payment or private mortgage insurance required.

column.name: eligibility_criteria
column.value: Veterans with sufficient service time and satisfactory credit

column.name: name
column.value: Wounded Warrior Project Financial Assistance

column.name: description
column.value: Emergency financial assistance for wounded Veterans facing financial hardship. Provides support for basic needs including rent, utilities, vehicle payments, and other essential expenses.

column.name: eligibility_criteria
column.value: Post-9/11 Veterans with service-connected injuries

column.name: name
column.value: Post-9/11 GI Bill

column.name: description
column.value: The Post-9/11 GI Bill helps you pay for school or job training. If you've served on active duty after September 10, 2001, you may qualify for this VA-administered education benefit. Benefits include tuition and fees, monthly housing allowance, and books and supplies stipend.

column.name: eligibility_criteria
column.value: Veterans with at least 90 days of aggregate active duty service after 9/10/2001

column.name: name
column.value: Vocational Rehabilitation and Employment (VR&E)

column.name: description
column.value: Also called Chapter 31, this program helps Veterans with service-connected disabilities prepare for, find, and keep suitable jobs. For Veterans with service-connected disabilities so severe that they cannot work, VR&E offers services to help them live as independently as possible.

column.name: eligibility_criteria
column.value: Veterans with service-connected disability rating of at least 10%

column.name: name
column.value: Veterans Upward Bound

column.name: description
column.value: Free program designed to help Veterans refresh their academic skills so that they can successfully complete the post-secondary education of their choosing. Services include assessment, tutoring, counseling, and instruction in core subjects.

column.name: eligibility_criteria
column.value: Veterans who are low-income or first-generation college students

column.name: name
column.value: Troops to Teachers

column.name: description
column.value: Helps eligible military personnel begin new careers as teachers in public schools. Provides assistance with teacher certification and employment in schools that serve students from low-income families.

column.name: eligibility_criteria
column.value: Veterans and transitioning service members interested in teaching careers

column.name: name
column.value: Veterans Crisis Line

column.name: description
column.value: Free, confidential support for Veterans in crisis and their families and friends 24/7/365. Connect with a caring, qualified responder through a confidential toll-free hotline, online chat, or text messaging service.

column.name: phone_number
column.value: 988 (Press 1)

column.name: eligibility_criteria
column.value: All Veterans, service members, National Guard, Reserve, and their families and friends

column.name: name
column.value: VA PTSD Program Locator

column.name: description
column.value: Find specialized PTSD treatment programs at VA medical centers across the country. These programs offer evidence-based treatments including Cognitive Processing Therapy and Prolonged Exposure therapy delivered by trained PTSD specialists.

column.name: eligibility_criteria
column.value: Veterans enrolled in VA health care

column.name: name
column.value: Vet Centers

column.name: description
column.value: Community-based counseling centers that provide a wide range of social and psychological services, including professional readjustment counseling to Veterans, active duty service members, and their families. Services include individual and group counseling for PTSD, depression, bereavement, and military sexual trauma.

column.name: eligibility_criteria
column.value: Veterans who served in any combat zone, provided military emergency response, or experienced military sexual trauma

column.name: name
column.value: Give an Hour

column.name: description
column.value: National nonprofit providing free mental health services to military members, Veterans, and their families. Network of licensed mental health professionals donate their time to provide counseling services at no cost.

column.name: eligibility_criteria
column.value: Current and former military service members and their families

column.name: name
column.value: Cohen Veterans Network

column.name: description
column.value: Network of mental health clinics for post-9/11 Veterans and their families offering high-quality, accessible, and integrated mental health care at no cost.

column.name: eligibility_criteria
column.value: Post-9/11 Veterans and their families

column.name: name
column.value: VA Health Care Enrollment

column.name: description
column.value: Apply for VA health care benefits. Once enrolled, you can get care at VA medical centers and clinics near you. VA health care covers preventive care services, inpatient and outpatient services, prescriptions, mental health care, and more.

column.name: eligibility_criteria
column.value: Veterans who served in active military and were discharged under conditions other than dishonorable

column.name: name
column.value: VA Telehealth Services

column.name: description
column.value: Connect with your VA health care team from your home or anywhere you have an internet connection. VA Video Connect allows you to meet with your VA provider through live video on your computer, tablet, or mobile device.

column.name: eligibility_criteria
column.value: Veterans enrolled in VA health care

column.name: name
column.value: VA Dental Benefits

column.name: description
column.value: Dental care for eligible Veterans including preventive services, restorative services, and emergency care. Eligibility varies based on service-connected disability rating and other factors.

column.name: eligibility_criteria
column.value: Veterans with service-connected dental conditions or disabilities rated 100%

column.name: name
column.value: TRICARE For Life

column.name: description
column.value: Medicare-wraparound coverage for those who are 65 or older, or under 65 and eligible for Medicare Part A because of a disability or end-stage renal disease. Provides comprehensive health coverage.

column.name: eligibility_criteria
column.value: Military retirees age 65+ enrolled in Medicare Part A and Part B

column.name: name
column.value: VA Caregiver Support Program

column.name: description
column.value: Support services for family caregivers of Veterans including education, resources, support services, and financial assistance for caregivers of seriously injured post-9/11 Veterans.

column.name: eligibility_criteria
column.value: Family caregivers of eligible Veterans
